content.description:
Follow an easy crack on the left side of the formation up to a hollow sounding flake that's eventually gonna come off. Pretty solid right now though, fam.

Anchor is a piece of work, but not too challenging. Descend formation and start hiking off until you find the thin crack slanting down to the left on the opposite wall. Bam.
content.protection:
-Single rack to 2 or 3

-50m rope

-Tiny cams, two cords, and about 40ft static rope for anchor
content.location: Just left of trail. Check GPS coordinates for this sub-area and match the image with the map. Sorry it's not more precise.

climbs.name: Chrusp's Special Pancakes
climbs.fa: Chrusp after whipping up a fresh batch of pregnant pancakes. What a lot of work I tells ya.

content.description: A crack which ends at a horizontal crack most of the way up the face. Follow crack up and traverse left once you hit the hornyzontal crack. Same anchor as SMAS.
content.protection:
-Single rack to 2. I think I placed a small offset nut in the crack, then a #2 C4 in the horizontal section.

-50m rope

-50ft static rope for anchor

-Usual other anchor kit (couple cords)
content.location: Just right of Slow Moving Australian Sandwich.
